meanings.definition: A person who signs a document with another person, agreeing to be responsible for the debt if the other person fails to repay it.
meanings.sent1: My sister and I were cosigners on the loan, so we both had to make sure the payments were made.
meanings.sent2: The cosigners on the lease were equally liable for any damages caused to the property.
meanings.sent3: The cosigners formed a pact to always support each other financially, no matter what.
meanings.sent4: Being cosigners was like being tied together in a financial knot, unable to break free.
meanings.sent5: The concept of cosigners is like having a financial safety net, ensuring someone has your back in tough times.

meanings.sent1: The bank required all cosigners to be present to sign the loan agreement.
meanings.sent2: The cosigners' signatures were needed to finalize the contract.
meanings.sent3: The room was filled with cosigners, all ready to support their friends in need.
meanings.sent4: The cosigners stood united, ready to face any financial challenges together.
meanings.sent5: In times of financial uncertainty, having cosigners can provide a sense of security and shared responsibility.
